channel.title: Getting Started on
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Kythera is a toolset for Filecoin Virtual Machine Native Actor development, testing and deployment. The ambition is to become the core boilerplate for any native projects developed in any FVM supported languages. its goal is to ease testing of native actors at the Wasm level, deploy the actors on any FVM-compatible network and interact with them. Sections # Getting started To get started with Kythera, install Kythera and setup your first project.

item.title: Installation
item.description: Building from source # You can build Kythera binary directly from our main repository through cargo: $ cargo install --git https://github.com/polyphene/kythera --force kythera-cli Local project # You can build Kythera binary through a local clone of the project. First, clone the repository: $ git clone https://github.com/polyphene/kythera.git Then, run: $ cargo build --bin kythera The Kythera binary should now be accessible at the root of the project.
